RESOURCE.NAME: GATE JSON Tweet Document Format
RESOURCE.COMMENT: Format parser for Twitter JSON files

RESOURCE.NAME: GATE JSON Exporter
RESOURCE.COMMENT: Export documents and corpora in JSON format

PARAMETER.NAME: annotationTypes
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Annotation types to export. Plain annotation types will be taken from the set named by the annotationSetName parameter, entries containing a colon are treated as setName:type (with an empty setName denoting the default set).

PARAMETER.NAME: entitiesAnnotationSetName
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The annotation set from which otherwise-unspecified entity annotations will be taken

PARAMETER.NAME: exportAsArray
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Whether to wrap the output as a JSON array. When exporting a corpus, true will write a JSON array of objects, one per document, whereas false will simply output one object per document separated by newlines.

PARAMETER.NAME: documentAnnotationASName
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Annotation set in which the "document annotation" can be found. These annotations serve to delimit the parts of the document that should be output, and the result will contain one JSON object per annotation, with the annotation's features as additional JSON properties.

PARAMETER.NAME: documentAnnotationType
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Annotation type for "document annotations". These annotations serve to delimit the parts of the document that should be output, and the result will contain one JSON object per annotation, with the annotation's features as additional JSON properties. If unspecified, or if a given GATE document contains none of these annotations, then the whole document content will be output.

RESOURCE.NAME: Twitter Corpus Populator
RESOURCE.COMMENT: Populate a corpus from Twitter JSON containing multiple Tweets

PARAMETER.NAME: corpus
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The corpus containing the document to process

PARAMETER.NAME: document
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The document to process

RESOURCE.NAME: Tweet Normaliser
RESOURCE.COMMENT: Normalise texts in tweets (convert into standard English spelling mistakes, colloquialisms, typing variations and so on)

PARAMETER.NAME: inputASName
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Input annotation set name

PARAMETER.NAME: outputASName
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Output annotation set name

PARAMETER.NAME: normTextFeature
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Feature to which the normalised text should be saved

PARAMETER.NAME: initialTextFeature
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Feature on Token annotations in the input AS that contains the token string

PARAMETER.NAME: origTextFeature
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Feature to which the original text should be saved

PARAMETER.NAME: dictURL
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Path to JaSpell dictionary

PARAMETER.NAME: orthURL
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Path to common normalisation terms list (for orthographic mappings, e.g. 'b4' to 'before')

PARAMETER.NAME: maxDistance
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Maximum distance to consider (this determines OOV/IV threshold). Based on Levenshtein edit dist (with a case change downweighted to 0.5) and double-metaphone.

PARAMETER.NAME: corpus
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The corpus containing the document to process

PARAMETER.NAME: document
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The document to process

RESOURCE.NAME: Twitter POS Tagger (EN)
RESOURCE.COMMENT: Stanford POS tagger trained on Tweets

PARAMETER.NAME: modelFile
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Path to the tagger's model file

PARAMETER.NAME: inputASName
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Input annotation set name

PARAMETER.NAME: outputASName
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Output annotation set name

PARAMETER.NAME: baseTokenAnnotationType
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Annotation type for what should be considered as atomic words to PoS tag

PARAMETER.NAME: baseSentenceAnnotationType
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Sentence-level annotation type

PARAMETER.NAME: outputAnnotationType
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Output annotation type for words (e.g. Token)

PARAMETER.NAME: failOnMissingInputAnnotations
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Throw an exception when there are none of the required input annotations

PARAMETER.NAME: posTagAllTokens
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Should all Tokens be POS tagged or just those within baseSentenceAnnotationType?

PARAMETER.NAME: useExistingTags
PARAMETER.COMMENT: Should existing category features on input annotations be respected (true) or ignored (false)?

PARAMETER.NAME: corpus
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The corpus containing the document to process

PARAMETER.NAME: document
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The document to process

PARAMETER.NAME: transducerGrammarURL
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The URL to the rules file

PARAMETER.NAME: encoding
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The encoding used for reading the definitions

PARAMETER.NAME: annotationSetName
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The annotation set to be used for the generated annotations

PARAMETER.NAME: tokeniserRulesURL
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The URL to the rules file

PARAMETER.NAME: corpus
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The corpus containing the document to process

PARAMETER.NAME: document
PARAMETER.COMMENT: The document to process
